Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: Lahes
Reviews.Content: Good position, in Chinatown and good for Darling Harbour. 'units' okay, very cheaply furnished. Good if you get it for the right price. Clean

Reviews.Title: “Easy access, great location”
Reviews.Author: Still_lots_to_do
Reviews.Content: Mum and teenage daughter found this to be super convenient and comfortable. Easy access to trains, monorail and lots on foot so getting around not a problem. Room was comfy, a bit noisy on Friday night but we still went to sleep easily. We didn't have a proper kitchen, but could have easily made simple meals. The fridge was not working upon check-in, but we mentioned this and came back that night to a new fridge with our water etc. replaced---great. Lots to see and do right on your doorstep and super convenient to the Entertainment Centre, for those who don't want to get home after seeing a show. The only thing I would have liked was an internal lock. The key entry is fine, but at night I prefer to be able to slide a bolt or chain, especially in the city, and this was not an option. Apart from that small thing, it was fabulous. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple re-QUEST equals the trip advisor test.”
Reviews.Author: Onemorereview
Reviews.Content: Simply request of room transfer between two bookings resulted in disaster and wasted time. Room was not ready. Understandable! Bags were kindly stored and were told that bags would be transferred to said room awaiting our new check-in at 10:00am. All good till we arrived 7:00pm to check-in. Room was wrong configuration and bags missing. Was told to return to room and look for bags again. Bags were found in reception area 25 plus min later after looking in other store rooms. We were changed to a more suitable room. Bags taken to room. Upon return one bag had been dammaged. Not once was an apology given. Great location average service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: AshbyHouse
Reviews.Content: Quest on Dixon's staff are very friendly, polite and helpful. Studio apartment well equipped, very clean and in a great location. Pleasantly surprised at generous size of accommodation. A bit noisy from street on Friday and Saturday night but it is the middle of the city so not too bad. Close proximity to Darling Harbour and Chinatown a big bonus for us. Only criticism was the bed was not very comfortable and neither were the pillows. Could have lived with a hard mattress if the pillows were great, but not the case. Also, access to internet as part of the tariff should be normal practice these days. Overall would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible unprofessional staff. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Juliatwyman
Reviews.Content: The location itself was great for the price, just a few minutes walk from central station and directly opposite darling harbor. However the front reception desk was extremely rude and did not speak proficient English.. We were told that there was a carpark for overnight stays Which cost $40. We queried this with the man at reception and he said 'yes yes pay in the motning' when we showed him our parking ticket as we were checking out he said it was the wrong car park and he couldn't help us. It cost us $75 for parking and the $200 bond he took for the room took a week to go back into my account. Would not stay here again on the count of rude staff!

Reviews.Title: “Well located near Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: Seema B
Reviews.Content: We had a fairly biggish room. With everything in place. Does not have a lobby or waiting area to boast of. And all public access areas are very downmarket. Like most carpeted hotels which are dusty, so was this. There was no servicing available but we did not stay long so it wasn't a problem for us. Lot of Asian eateries in the area. Eat at your own risk. The Chinese Garden is nearby and so is the Harbourside, Aquarium, etc. And walking distance to many must do places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderful rooms. Shame about the lack of staff...”
Reviews.Author: jodie_amanda
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Quest on Dixon for one night in December. On arrival we had no problem checking in, and were both very pleased with our room. The hotel is located in the heart of the city - right next to the Chinese Gardens at Darling Harbour. Monorail and light rail stations were both located within a short walking distance of the hotel, which made it simple to get around the city. At night we found plenty of international eateries located across the road, open until the early hours. Despite the fact that these apartments are located in a prime part of the city we had no problem with outside noise while in our room, and the block out curtains and soft mattress meant that we both got an excellent nights sleep. Our only major problem occured when we had to check out. As there was only one person working on the front desk at the reception area it took us 20 minutes to check out. We decided to leave our bag at the hotel and have one last look around the city before heading home. When we came back to retreive our back we found an even bigger line up in the foyer, and ended up missing our train home. Overall, we found the place to be excellent, though I'm sure it wouldn't kill management to put on one extra staff member during peak periods, particularly during the holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for business, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: joffw
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights here in November while I had some meetings in Darling Harbour. The location is fantastic, and its only a minutes walk from the new Darling Quarter development. I did not receive any servicing of my room while I stayed however - Whilst I had do not disturb on the door for the first two days when I had lots of work equipment strewn around the room, I would have expected that the room would have been serviced on the final two days when no such sign was on the door. The rooms are of reasonable size for a serviced apartment but were nothing special. Considering the location, Quest on Dixon is a convenient place to stay, but I only received an apartment, no servicing!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book any Quest Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Lloyd91771
Reviews.Content: After several misfortunes on our vacation this hotel was by far the worse. We had confirmed reservation Nov 16-20, 2011. Upon arrival the desk clerk said we had no reservation. I showed him the paperwork with the confirmation number and dates of our stay. He was rude and refused us a room. Two others came in after us and were given the same story we were given, the reservation had been cancelled. We asked to talk to the manager and that was refused. Upon my wife checking several other hotels in the area, she was told that there were no rooms to be gotten in Sidney. since there were allot of conventions in town. We thus went back to the airport and spent the night in a semi lock down small area of the airport. The next morning we got a flight back to LAX 4 days earlier than planned It was the vacation from hell. Never book a Quest Hotel and save yourself allot of grief and anger in our view point and experience. We will never again travel to Australia after how we were treated by this place and several other incidents in Cairns.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: DukeOfCumberland
Reviews.Content: This is a grubby hotel in a grubby area with disinterested staff. In fact, you can't call it a hotel. The only facility it has is a vending machine. Despite booking and paying in advance I was asked for a AUS$400 deposit against "breakages". I doubt the whole contents of the room were worth half that. When I showed them the booking terms which didn't mention such a deposit, the manager just said no deposit, no key. Welcome ! The rooms are quite large, but the few pieces of 1970s furniture scattered around the room just made it look bare. Someone should also tell the management that if you offer tea and coffee and cups etc, it might be helpful to also supply a kettle. You would be better staying in a hostel than this place, it couldn't be any worse and it would be a lot cheaper. It's only saving grace is that it was a short walk to darling harbour, which just goes to show (like most major cities) it doesn't take long to go from a good area to a dreadful one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: gilbycr
Reviews.Content: I don't think that you could get a better location in Sydney. Right in the heart of Chinatown and the very edge of Darling Harbour. Rooms were large and we had a balcony. No bells and whistles such as a gym, bar or restaurant but that was ok. Pretty good value for money. Overall very happy and would stay again. Our room was really quiet considering what was going on outside.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: danastarr
Reviews.Content: Ordinary place. Disinterested staff, hallways smelled like smoke, ordinary rooms. Location is good - close to Darling Harbour, just a short walk from the train station. I suppose if you had to work in the area you might stay here (perhaps we were not the target demographic), but I found the whole place depressing. Window opened out onto the steam shaft of a neighbouring hotel. The rooms seemed clean but the vibe of the place was unclean and ... in a word, ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, handy for convention centre”
Reviews.Author: ochlophobic
Reviews.Content: The Executive Studio apartment was large and comfortable with a balcony, even if the view was of some apartments across the narrow street. The kitchen facilities were rather basic, with a microwave, plug in hot plate and no dishwasher. The location was convenient for attending the Sydney Convention Centre and was also only a short distance from the Town Hall area of the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Great central location and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Zapjelly
Reviews.Content: Very spacious room! I thought the staff was friendly and very helpful. They let us leave our bags there after our checkout. It was quiet considering it's in the middle of Chinatown! Comfortable big bed and nice shower! Have no problem going back to Quest on Dixon.

Reviews.Title: “Quite downmarket - not really suitable for Business”
Reviews.Author: essendontvl
Reviews.Content: I stay every week in Sydney in a serviced apartment for business. I spent a week here in a studio. The hotel feels like just a residential apartment block, with few Quest rooms for sale and lots of residents coming and going. It had a small kitchenette which was OK, but the whole apartment felt crampt, very dated and not very well maintained. The bed was squeezed between the TV and the wall, and was very low and uncomfortable. In fact when I arrived I really did not want to stay the week. The upside is lots of restaurants close by and they do offer great rates, i guess you get what you pay for. I would not stay again - but if you want cheap, good location for a night or 2 this could be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Central Location but Tired and Bit Glum”
Reviews.Author: Marek010
Reviews.Content: Set in amongst the backpackers and buzz of Chinatown there is no doubt that the Quest on Dixon is well located in downtown Sydney. A convenient place to stay if you're attending a Fair/Conference at Darling Harbour with just a short stroll to the Convention Centre. The overall atmosphere here is a bit glum, dank & dingy; although the rooms are spacious and have all the facilities you would want I would hate to be staying here for more than a few days...why is it that the smell of take away food still lingers in lift shafts and corridors for days afterwards? This place also needs a good refurbishment!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: mouseholemax
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this accommodation...clean, well appointed room, comfortable bed, bright bathroom, courteous staff, but best of all is the location - right on the edge of Chinatown and Darling Harbour and a short walk to Paddy's Market and the Entertainment Centre. Don't expect expansive views as it is located on a quiet and narrow street, but it means you are away from the noise of the city and will sleep well. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean spacious room”
Reviews.Author: thatsalot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Location is great, just next to Chinatown. Room was very spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe for business - but not for leisure”
Reviews.Author: Little_Miss_Madam82
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for work and was a bit disapointed. Definitely not a luxurious stay - no foxtel, dingy reception area and I didnt feel that safe walking into the hotel at night (in an alley in Chinatown). While the room was quite nice and clean and the staff were friendly enough - it isn't a hotel I would come back to for a romantic weekend or to chill out. No gym, room service, spa etc. I also paid around $160 for the room - which I think was on the pricey side compared to other Sydney hotels that you could stay in at for only a little more $$ but a lot more luxury...

Reviews.Title: “you do not get told”
Reviews.Author: Europe556
Reviews.Content: The staff are rude! Watch out when you stay here as they do not tell you that it takes 3/5 working days to receive the $200 bond back that they take out of your account! I would recommend not staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - good value”
Reviews.Author: Swanee59
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at one end of Chinatown so you don't have far to go for dinner. Rooms are large although the shower is tiny, which is strange because the bathroom itself is quite roomy. No extra Foxtel channels, which was bit annoying because it was Thursday night and I wanted to watch the footy shows. The hotel is located on a mall, so there is no traffic noise outside the hotel. Staff are friendly

Reviews.Title: “will stay again”
Reviews.Author: DeeAus
Reviews.Content: I didnt know what to expect from this apartment coz i have read the reviews and there was a mixed opinion. I decided to go ahead coz i saw the pic of the toilet and it looks clean. Besides, i have stayed at other Quests serviced apartment and i dont have any problems so far. It was located near the chinatown area or rather at the chinatown area. At first i thought, it's gonna be dirty...but surprisingly, it is not! The staff were excellent and helpful. And there are so many restaurants nearby, in fact i reckon the location is actually quite a good location. I enjoyed my stay. Although, yes...my room is pretty small with no balcony and no view but i was on a budget and i think this service apartment is really a good deal. I am so used to expensive and luxurious hotel but going to sydney on my own and on my own budget, this aprtment is what i can afford and i am very happy with it. For the muslims, there are like 3 halal restaurants just next door and opposite. For those who love asian food, there are sooo many choices around the apartment. In fact, just a walking distance, there is a pub and a row of spanish food. And you can walk to darling harbour (IMAX theatre) where there are more western food choices by the the harbour. They even do delivery for some of the restaurants!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, inconvenient for transport and a bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: madwolf3070
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights for business, inconvenient location as the taxi wouldn't/couldnt drop me any closer than the end of Dixon street, only a few hundred metres walk but irritating while juggling laptop, trolley case etc. Lots of noise from neighbouring buildings, it's right int he middle of a densely packed area so perhaps to be expected, nonethless I had two nights of broken sleep due to loud music from the apartments 2 metres across the laneway from my hotel room window. one big gripe, the woman at the front desk called me a taxi on departure, which took 20+ minutes to arrive (due to the location issues mentioned above). More importantly she completely neglected to tell me that her call would incur a $12 BOOKING FEE from the taxi company. Very unimpressed. Staff generally pleasant and room amenities pretty standard for this type of serviced apartment. overall a little overpriced for what t delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably shocking service on arrival, better after, good room, great location”
Reviews.Author: PhacoMan
Reviews.Content: Absolutely shocking service on arrival at 9pm with wife and 2 and 4 year olds (when we booked, we advised arrival at 9:30pm and young kids). Reception closed at 8pm. Number to call to get code for electronic safe for key kept me waiting for 20 minutes when I called with my phone on roaming rates. Tried 2nd time and left a message. No reply. 3rd try got through to someone at Quest World Square who said someone would be there in 10-15 minutes. No one turned up after 75 minutes wait. Managed to call Sales Manager, Mr Bawa, who promptly organized for the receptionist from Quest World Square to come over to check us in. By now we had waited at least 90 mins. Kids absolutely losing it and 2 sets of customers had offered us their rooms while waiting. Receptionist turned up 10 minutes later, walked past us without any acknowledgement, straight to the reception area. We asked him what happened to the person who was supposed to come and let us in. He said that person actually not available but neither one of them bothered to try to contact us. He had the nerve to tell us that he had left 2 clients waiting at the other facility to let us in. TRYING TO GET AN APOLOGY FROM ANYONE HERE IS LIKE GETTING BLOOD OUT OF A STONE! Tired and kids losing it, staff at this facility need to be retrained that there is a simple solution. You can't undo the late situation (on booking, we advised that we were arriving by 9:30pm and with a 2 and 4 year old). JUST APOLOGISE AND ASSURE US IT WON'T HAPPEN AGAIN. Stayed 19-24/3/11. Service next few days friendly, still no apologies. Room good. Location is great. Can't decide if we will be back...

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: lowcarbon
Reviews.Content: Second time at these apartments and we took some friends with us this time. You just cannot beat the location. The front desk attendant remembered us from last time and gave us the sort of service I love, helpful and obliging when asked. Anyone who has stayed at Quest will know what to expect, clean no frills accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Seedy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: megsi44
Reviews.Content: Just spent one night here - thank goodness. I'm used to traveling cheaply and 'roughing' it a bit but this so called apartment was really average. On the edge on China town in Sydney - not that that's a bad thing but it's just a seedy downtown area and a funny little street. I didn't feel that safe walking around at night by myself. I also didn't feel that safe in my room - the balcony door didn't lock. I ended up putting my heavy suitcase against the door just in case! It was pretty noisy too and like other reviews - even though I'd booked and paid online in advance the reception staff insisted I also put a $200 hold through on my credit card that will take a few days to clear once I've checked out! Makes you wonder what actually goes on there. To be honest it did feel a little bit like the rooms could be rented by the hour if you know what I mean. It was meant to be a serviced apartment - there were hard any cooking utensils, one pot, chipped mismatched plates and only 2-3 knives and forks. The bathroom was clean but very tired and run down. The couch was filthy and the curtains were torn and coming down at the corners. Yeah so basically - a pretty rough place and was glad that I only had to stay one night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great base to explore Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: milly80
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have picked a better location for our 4-night stay in Sydney. We got an excellent deal through their website especially compared to other Sydney hotels/apartments at this time of year. Based on the edge of Darling Harbour and Chinatown, a whole host of food choices were only a short stroll away. We actually explored most of Sydney on foot (to the detriment of our poor feet afterwards!) but if you are a walker, it's possible. Quest accommodation in a studio apartment consisted of a double bed, small kitchenette (microwave, toaster, electric hob, sink, fridge, kettle), balcony, double sofa bed (so in fact the studio could have slept 4 people) and shower / toilet room. If I had to grumble about something it would be that at night there was quite a bit of noise from the street outside, with revellers coming home, but it's fairly normal for a city location. Would definitely recommend as a good base to explore Sydney, and suits a budget.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lindatravelgirl
Reviews.Content: A great price for the area. Big room, mini fully stocked kitchen, nice big private patio. Easy walk to everywhere in Sydney. Room was very comfortable except for the lack of good air conditioning. Also don't arrive on a Holiday because you won't be able to check in until someone arrives for a reduced working schedule. This is NOT a hotel but a Service Apartment with limited front desk hours. No amenities but I would stay again because of the price and convenience. Spent less than $100USD per night.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms and a good location”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: Quest on Dixon offers a reasonably typical Quest experience - big, well equipped rooms in a decent location with poor front desk service. Rooms were fitted out to a good standard, and had microwave and irons. The room itself was huge - at least double the size of a normal hotel - and also had a massive balcony overlooking Dixon St. There was some night time noise as you would expect in the inner city. Internet was $20 extra and very, very slow with regular drop outs. Overall, not bad value and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms in great location”
Reviews.Author: KaleneAndy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on business, and was very pleased with the choice. Competitively priced in an otherwise expensive area, the room was large and included a spacious outside balcony area. A small kitchette offered microwave, fridge and basic amneities (but no washing up materials, I noted!) With a sofa, table and desk, there really was space to spread out and relax, so it's a pity that I was away for much of my stay. The breakfast pack was reasonable value at $10, and there are charge-back options from some local cafes. On the downside, there is an annoying low step into the bathroom, which I'd guess has bruised a few toes over time. It also took some time for the shower to warm up. However, it makes a good base for the Darling Harbour area, and is within easy walking distance of much of central Sydney. I'd readily stay here again should circumstances require.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel that didnt charge me for a cot!”
Reviews.Author: scubadogz
Reviews.Content: We have 2 children under 3 and I was trying to find a self contained hotel to accomodate us without wanting to charge me for a roll away AND a cot per night. After several calls I was down hearted (roll aways and cot costing between $20 and $50 a night EXTRA). My 5th call was to the Quest on Dixon, the receptionist gave me 2 cots for free for our 4 night stay and an executive room for $175 a night ($25 less than all the other rooms in the other hotels). It was a walk from Darling Harbour itself but it was right in the heart of China Town and we loved it. It was just like being in Singapore, everyone was really friendly and the food courts offered plenty for our fussy 3 year old and happy 20 month old to eat at a reasonable price. We enjoyed the Chinese gardens which are a must with children as you can feed the carp with food from the tea house shop for $1. The hotel was nothing majorly special but it was clean, quite modern, easy to get to and the rooms were big enough to hide the cots in the corner so we could still read without the children being disturbed by the light on. There is also a FREE washing machine and drier on the 5th and 3rd floors

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Very Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: emelda_1
Reviews.Content: Good for location and central to china town , darling harbour and city. Very poor staff service and help. It took us an 1hr to park our car as we were given wrong information for using thier car park each time. Bad personal experience with items left behind (my fault) BUT never to be seen again... and the staff make it stressful when it is meant to be relaxing. Front desk operator could not tell us where some significant landmarks were that we requested etc Unfortunately I cannot recommend this place - there are plenty of other options in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: NinjaBear
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 1 bedroom apartment at Quest on Dixon St over the weekend with a group of friends. The booking procedure was quite efficient and I had specifically requested a room that had 3 separate beds (one sofa, one pull out bed and one queen bed all in the one room). The room was clean and spacious and the bathroom was also quite nice. The rooms are not flashy like hotel rooms, but we were specifically after a serviced apartment as space was a requirement. The small kitchenette was handy and the amenities were adequate (flat screen tv, stereo, dvd player, small fridge). The balcony overlooked Chinatown with a small view the harbour which was nice, however there was an overwhelming aroma of asian cuisine. If you don't mind it too much, it was quite relaxing sitting out there with a few drinks and nibbles. Darling harbour is just a few mins walk from the building, and if you like cheap and cheerful, Chinatown is a good place for a quick bite. The entrance to the car park of the building was a little difficult to find, and you do need to obtain a key from reception in order to get access to parking ($40 per night). Overall, I think this place is good value for money - the rooms are not overly expensive, furniture is quite new and rooms are clean and spacious. For those exploring Sydney, it is conveniently located in the city and within walking distance to all the big attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Near the darling harbour”
Reviews.Author: satishskrish
Reviews.Content: A very roomy place and gives a home feeling. Excellent amenities and a pleasant reception incharge. Walk around the place and you can get to reach all shopping arcades and the harbour points.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment & location, but terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: KMtravelling
Reviews.Content: This apartment was great and only a 5 minute walk from Darling Harbour but the staff were terrible, ignoring our constant requests to fix the TV, giving us complettely wrong information about how long it takes to get to the airport (if we'd listened to them we would've missed our flight!) and then charging us $70 for a bed-runner that they thought was missing from the room (we eventually got the money back)! All in all, I would recommend staying here for the location and apartment quality, BUT just be aware that the customer service is non-existent.

Reviews.Title: “SO CLOSE TO EVERYTHING - STAFF FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: ShaneandRose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just a short walk from Darling Harbour, transport and shopping. It is a block from China town and Paddys Market which are both open everyday. Krystal at the desk was very efficent, knowledgeable and helpful with transport, attractions, booking airport shuttle bus, and restaurants. We were lucky as we got an upgrade and got a further upgrade because our Video on Demand wasn't working. It is the best place to stay in Sydney because it was really good value. The rooms were clean and spacious Unfortunately there were no views from this property but you got a huge balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: JimboAustralia
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic. 2 minute walk from Darling Harbour in China Town. Staff are friendly and helpful. We were checked into a room without a balcony which we had booked for, we were moved within the hour, new apartment a lot bigger. Kitchen facilities are ok, no stove or oven but a portable stove top with 2 elements. We only had one fry pan, no other pots or pans. Car park is one way so be careful as you are likely to meet someone going up the ramp, very dodgy! Our air con was poor and our toilet keep blocking. Room was quiet and together with the good location, it was ok for the price we paid but don't expect anything fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, but lacking in soul”
Reviews.Author: JulzE
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is close to China town and I like the late night atmosphere after a long day of meetings in Sydney. Its good to be able to walk to restaurants and shops that are open late, and with plenty of people around. This hotel is opposite a cute little Japanese restaurant that is good for a beer and Obento box. The hotel provides good basic accommodation but is lacking in those little touches that make hotels seem special places to stay. Also, I had to run the hot water for quite a long time in the morning before the shower warmed up. The reception staff were friendly enough. This wouldn't be my number one choice but I wouldn't recommend against it either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Stay”
Reviews.Author: PharmGirl70
Reviews.Content: We stayed through New Year and it was a fantastic location! We could walk to all the major attractions and public transportation. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was a great place for a family stay in Sydney center, with Tumbalong park nearby for the kids to play. The studio was fine, but we upgraded to a one bedroom that was much more spacious and better suited to a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: merseytripper
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated on the edge of Darling Harbour and China Town, 5 minutes walk from Paddy's market. Accommodation was clean and comfortable. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a 1 bedroom apartment with laundry facilities, but if you are in a studio, there are laundry facilities in the hotel for guest use -the washing powder is free. The staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is a 5 minute walk fromTown Hall train station - from which you can buy an all day pass for use on all ferries, trains and buses. Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hymn
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Quest at 08.30 on a Saturday morning very tired from our UK flight. Asked to leave our bags in reception whilst awaiting access at 14.00 to our Studio Room. We were immediately advised that a room was available and given a key to a 1 Bed Appt. This enabled us to grab a couple of hours needed sleep before venturing out on our first visit to Sydney. The Appt was large with a big bedroom and even bigger lounge with full kitchen facilities. The bathroom was very clean with a good power shower and toiletries provided. We had a balcony with table and chairs which was an added bonus. Whilst we used the Appt as mainly a base to sleep, it also had TV/DVD/CD. The location was excellent for us, situated as it is only a 2 minute walk to Darling Harbour if you turn right out of the front door and 2 minute walk to Chinatown if you turn left. With Sydney being a relatively small city we could easily walk to almost anywhere, within the city, in 20 minutes. The main shopping centre was about a 10 minute walk. We found the reception staff to be exceedingly friendly and very helpful, although we had no real need for much contact. The room was very quiet with little noise from the road outside, which is partly pedestrianised. All in all the Quest was a great place to stay and at Â£75 per night for a 3 night stay, (Booked over the internet), I thought it was good value for money, for a CIty Centre Hotel/Appt. My wife & I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Leisurepro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in February after initially only intending to stay for a night before moving on to another hotel. We were moved from a perfectly adequate rear room after the first night to a huge front suite with a massive balcony at the front of the building.The room had a well equipped kitchen area and was well serviced daily. An additional bonus here is the car park in the basement as otherwise, parking would have been a nightmare. The postion of the property is ideal and within walking distance of most things. A special mention should be made about Sebastian, the receptionist, who was a gem in terms of a welcoming prescence and of giving information on places we wished to get to. Next time we're in Sydney we'll return to the Quest.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good. Had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great staff. Very large room that was a studio. Balcony. All was good and the location was perfect with the city and restaraunts and Darling Harbour at the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment”
Reviews.Author: Sygnet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Quest apartments for 4 ngihts in February while we were in town for the Global Challenge yacht race stopover. Our room was HUGE - very clean and tidy with nice decor. Convenient location close to Darling Harbour and central Sydney. To be honest we really only slept in our room and were out and about during the day. Just remember - it's serviced apartments not a hotel so no room service, bell boys etc.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Location - lacking in other areas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here before, I made the reservation with confidence. The location to China Town, Paddy's Market, Darling Harbor and theatre made it idea for me and my companion (elderly relative). Dixon Street is quite scary at night with its abandoned buildings and dark pathways. The hotel knew that we were 2 women traveling together. They gave us a teeny room, hardly a 'suite' as advertised, with one bed. The additional bed and bedding cost over $60.00 extra! We would have saved money by buying linnen at Paddy's Market! Their attituide towards this was horrid. It is clean and convenient. You can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights at Quest on Dixon. The accommodation was superb. The room was spacious, well equipped and spotlessly clean. There was a kitchen, lounge area, queen bed and spacious bathroom. The location is fantastic. We were able to explore Darling Harbour, visit the cafes and markets of China Town, eat Spanish and easily catch trains, buses or ferries. We thought that Quest on Dixon was an outstanding place to stay and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Expect more”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed Quest on Dixon considering how it was made out to be. I disagree with the 4 star rating. Considering it was the last night i was spending with my boyfriend for 2 months i was expecting something much nicer. Our room had no balcony, it was facing to the back overlooking the roof of some seedy building. The picture on the website is false - there is massive hotel in front of it, so even if you did have a balcony you would have nothing to look at anyway. It also only 5 stories high - the pictures makes it out to be much much bigger. The door was paper thin and you could hear everything in the hall way. A bath would of been nice. Everytime we came downstairs the man at the desk gave us filthy looks. There was no cable channels, the air conditioner didnt work. The only thing going for this hotel is the location to darling harbour and chinatown. THATS IT. Overall i was quite disappointed. If anyone pays the full rate of $209 they are completely insane - i think even $145 was a bit steep. I recommend paying the extra $20 or so and staying at one of the bigger hotels. Next time i will be for sure. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worse than I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All the information on the Internet makes Quest on Dixon out to be a great place to stay... it's not (with a few exceptions). First off, it's not a hotel. It's a "serviced apartment" and the differences are quite apparent. Even the hotel pictures on the Internet are misleading; they've been doctored up a lot. Only the hotel structure itself is real, the rest is digitally added. It's located on a tiny one way street, basically an alley, next to boarded up retail shops, posters on the walls and dirty sidewalks. The location itself is not near any attractions or sights other than Darling Harbour and taxis are very expensive to get around the city. The rooms are _very_ minimally furnished. The "office desk" barely fits a laptop after they put a TV, mini-stereo, phone and desk light on it. The bathroom has NO countertops. Just a toilet, a small wall-mounted sink and a shower. They even taped a tissue box to the towel rack for lack of a flat surface above the floor. The doors are paper thin and everything can be heard outside the odd smelling hallway. Voices and doors opening/closing are very loud and woke me up on several occasions through the night. There is no in-room safe. There is no deadbolt or catch on the door. The "4 star hotel style lobby" is a small desk with only one person on duty between 7am-11pm. There is no after-hours check-in, and if you lose your key you can't get into the building until they open at 7am. The only thing going for Quest on Dixon is that it's inexpensive to stay for a long period of time. The direct-dial phone line doesn't incur any additional charges, there's a self-serve laudromat to save on outrageous hotel laundry services and a kitchenette to avoid eating out for every meal of the day. I would not recommend staying here for a short vacation or business trip. In fact I left Quest on Dixon 3 days early to check into a real hotel. It's very apparent that these serviced apartments are designed to be sold (of which they are, starting at AU$440,000!) as a city residence and to be furnished as such. A "4 star hotel" it is not.

HotelInfo.Name: Quest on Dixon Darling Harbour
HotelInfo.Address: 8 Dixon Street | Darling Harbour, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
